wikitext.*:
[[File:Royston F. Porthouse 1 June 1966.jpg|thumb]]
On [[1 June]] [[1966]], [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] wrote '''[[Letters not published in "The Letters of J.R.R. Tolkien"|a letter]] to Royston F. Porthouse''', a reader in Australia.<ref>{{webcite|author=|articleurl=http://www.manhattanrarebooks.com/pages/books/737/j-r-r-tolkien/typed-letter-signed|articlename=J.R.R. Tolkien: Typed Letter Signed|dated=|website=[http://www.manhattanrarebooks.com/ Manhattanrarebooks.com]|accessed=18 October 2013}}</ref>

*'''Subject:''' Replying to a letter of appreciation, Tolkien says "I am always pleased to hear from people who have read and enjoyed my books", and adds in a  postscript: "My next book will be called ''[[The Silmarillion]]''. It is about the [[First Age|First]] and [[Second Age|Second]] Ages."
*'''Description:''' Typed letter, signed. Size: 5.5" x 7".

{{references}}
